content:
• Thursday, July 25, 2013
  • WNR

    Western Refining (NYSE:WNR) files for an IPO of its Western Refining Logisitcs subsidiary; units...

    Western Refining (NYSE:WNR) files for an IPO of its Western Refining Logisitcs subsidiary; units would be listed on the NYSE with the ticker WNRL. The entity will own, operate, develop, and acquire terminals, storage tanks, pipelines and other logistics assets. WNR +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) -3.7% AH after issuing downside guidance following its FQ4 results that...

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) -3.7% AH after issuing downside guidance following its FQ4 results that beat expectations. KLAC sees FQ1 EPS of $0.53-$0.73 vs $0.85 consensus estimate and revenues of $620M-$680M vs. $737M consensus; also sees gross margins of 56%-57.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) CEO Dara Khosrowshahi was somewhat on the defensive in the Q2 earnings...

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) CEO Dara Khosrowshahi was somewhat on the defensive in the Q2 earnings conference call, admitting that May's Hotwire sale cost more than it recovered in revenue, and that TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) and Booking.com are hurting results. On the plus side, Trivago performed well, growing 80% Y/Y, and eLong expanded aggressively in Asia. EXPE -23.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • LOGM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LOGM +9%. SBUX +6%. RENN +6%. GILD +5%. CLF +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LOGM +9%. SBUX +6%. RENN +6%. GILD +5%. CLF +3%.
    After-hours top losers: TPX -13%. ZNGA -13%. OUTR -9%. VRTX -9%. GPN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • TPX

    Tempur Sealy (NYSE:TPX) falls 11.82% AH as earnings and revenue miss estimates. The integration...

    Tempur Sealy (NYSE:TPX) falls 11.82% AH as earnings and revenue miss estimates. The integration of Sealy causes gross margin to fall to 38.6% from 50.7%. CEO Mark Sarvary says the steps the company is taking "to return Tempur North America to growthÂ  … are taking longer than expected." Management trims its FY13 outlook, saying it now sees EPS of $2.25-2.40 on sales of $2.425-2.45B versus consensus of $2.75/ share on revenue of $2.5B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM

    NetSuite (NYSE:N): Q2 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $101M beats by $0.38M. Shares...

    Hutchinson Technology (NASDAQ:HTCH): Q2 EPS of -$0.41 misses by $0.2. Revenue of $61.3M misses...

    Hutchinson Technology (NASDAQ:HTCH): Q2 EPS of -$0.41 misses by $0.2. Revenue of $61.3M misses by $0.65M. Shares -7.5% AH. (PR)

  • CLF

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q2 results: Included in CLF's $146M profit was...

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF)Â Q2 results: Included in CLF's $146M profit was $9M in income-tax expenses and a $68M asset impairment charge, while prior-year results had $42M in income tax expenses. Generated $414M in cash from operations. U.S. iron ore sales volume rose 5.2%, while Asia-Pacific fell 2.6%; North America coal sales volume jumped 36%. CLF +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM

    TeleComm System (NASDAQ:TSYS): FQ3 EPS of -$0.01 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $92.8M (-19% Y/Y)...

    TeleComm System (NASDAQ:TSYS): FQ3 EPS of -$0.01 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $92.8M (-19% Y/Y) misses by $8.22M. Shares -9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • AWAY

    HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY): Q2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $86.6M (+20.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY): Q2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $86.6M (+20.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.88M. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)

  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) slump after the company misses the revenue estimates of...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) slump after the company misses the revenue estimates of analysts with its Q2 report. The Ugg brand dragged down results again with sales 6.9% lower Y/Y to $100.4M. On a positive note, e-commerce sales rose 34.2%, although at $10.7M the channel still accounts for only a small percentage of total sales compared to some other retailers. The company expects full-year revenue and EPS to improve by 8% over last year's mark. DECK -8.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Q2 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.5B (-5.7%...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Q2 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.5B (-5.7% Y/Y) beats by $90M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • CB

    More on Chubb (NYSE:CB) Q2 earnings: Operating income per share of $1.77 up 29% Y/Y. Catastrophe...

    More on Chubb (NYSE:CB) Q2 earnings: Operating income per share of $1.77 up 29% Y/Y. Catastrophe losses of $237M vs. $223M a year ago. Combined ratio falls (a good thing) to 88.8% from 93.8%, excluding catastrophes, it fell to 80.9% from 86.3%. Net written premiums of $3.1B flat Y/Y. P&C investment income of $286M off 6%. 3.7M shares repurchased at average of $87.28/share. $758 buyback authorization remains. FY13 EPS guidance is upped to $7.30-$7.50 from $6.40-$6.80 even as catastrophe loss assumption is raised to 4.6% from 4%. Shares +2.4% AH.Â CC at 5 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • QLIK

    Qlik Technologies (NASDAQ:QLIK): Q2 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $108M (+26% Y/Y)...

    Qlik Technologies (NASDAQ:QLIK): Q2 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $108M (+26% Y/Y) beats by $1.46M. Shares -5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • MXIM

    Maxim Integrated (NASDAQ:MXIM): FQ4 EPS of $0.44 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $608M misses by...

    Maxim Integrated (NASDAQ:MXIM): FQ4 EPS of $0.44 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $608M misses by $18.24M. Shares -6.69% AH. (PR)

  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA): Q2 EPS of $0.31 in-line. Revenue of $222.4M (+17% Y/Y) beats by...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA): Q2 EPS of $0.31 in-line. Revenue of $222.4M (+17% Y/Y) beats by $1.72M. Shares -7.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • SBUX

    More on Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ3: The company reported broad sales gains across regions with...

    More on Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) FQ3: The company reported broad sales gains across regions with comparable store sales rising 8% to easily beat its 5.6% pace from a year ago. By region, China/Asia Pacific stood out with the rate of traffic growth doubling Q/Q. Customers remained loyal, pre-loading cards faster than ever and absorbing price hikes. Starbucks opened 341 net new stores during the period. The news is just as rosy for FY14, with Starbucks forecasting double-digit revenue growth and operating margin improvement of approximately 150-200 bps over FY13. Shares +6.1% AH to $72.35 - a higher level than they have ever closed at.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) slides 10.3% AH as the company says the FDA has placed a...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) slides 10.3% AH as the company says the FDA has placed a partial clinical hold on the ongoing U.S. Phase 2 study of VX-135 due to concerns regarding elevated liver enzymes in patients receiving 400 mg doses in combination with ribavirin. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • FLEX

    Flextronics (NASDAQ:FLEX): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $5.79B beats by $0.34B....

    Flextronics (NASDAQ:FLEX): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $5.79B beats by $0.34B. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)

    SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI): Q2 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $77.5M (+21% Y/Y) misses by...

    SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI): Q2 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $77.5M (+21% Y/Y) misses by $1.44M. Shares -19.7% AH. (PR)

    Biomarin Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:BMRN): Q2 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $136.8M...

    Biomarin Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:BMRN): Q2 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $136.8M (+10.3% Y/Y) beats by $2.47M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • GILD

    More on Gilead Science's (NASDAQ:GILD) Q2: Revenues rise 15% Y/Y. Product sales rise 14% overall...

    More on Gilead Science's (NASDAQ:GILD) Q2: Revenues rise 15% Y/Y. Product sales rise 14% overall and 20% in the U.S. driven by growth in Complera/ Eviplera (+159% Y/Y). Stribild revenue was $99.394M during the period. Antiviral sales increase 15% to $2.31B. Antiviral sales growth by product: Atripla, +4%; Truvada, +3%; Viread, +16%. Cardiovascular product sales jump 19% Y/Y on a 26% increase in Letairis revenue. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    More on Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) Q2 earnings: Q3 EPS guidance of -$0.09 to -$0.05 (consensus is...

    More on Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) Q2 earnings: Q3 EPS guidance of -$0.09 to -$0.05 (consensus is -$0.02) on bookings of $125M-$150M. From Q2: Daily active users of 39M is off 45% Y/Y, off 24% Q/Q. Average daily bookings per average DAU of $0.053, up 14% Y/Y. Monthly unique payers of 1.9M off 53% Y/Y. "Biggest opportunity is to focus on free to play social games ... Zynga is making the focused choice not to pursue a license for real money gaming in the U.S." Shares -6.9% AH.Â CC at 5 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 14 Comments
  • DLB

    Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB): FQ3 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $207.1M misses by $1.7M....

    Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB): FQ3 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $207.1M misses by $1.7M. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q2 EPS of $0.50, in-line. Revenue of $2.77B, beats by $110M....

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q2 EPS of $0.50, in-line. Revenue of $2.77B, beats by $110M. Shares +1.87% AH. (PR)

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA): Q2 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $188M beats by $2.5M....

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA): Q2 EPS of -$0.01Â beats by $0.03. Revenue of $188M beats by $2.5M. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE): Q2 EPS of $0.64 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $1.21B misses by $0.05B....

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK): Q2 EPS of -$0.85 beats by $0.2. Revenue of $170.1M (-2.5% Y/Y)...

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK): Q2 EPS of -$0.85 beats by $0.2. Revenue of $170.1M (-2.5% Y/Y) misses by $9.3M. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • CRR

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR +16.6%) enjoys a big advance after reporting strong Q2 beats in earnings and...

    Carbo Ceramics (CRR +16.6%) enjoys a big advance after reporting strong Q2 beats in earnings and revenues. While admitting a difficult H1, CRR expects a better H2:Â "In the latter part of the quarter, we experienced increased demand for ceramics proppants and improved margins."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ASPS

    Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS +10.7%) flies higher after earnings, with the company...

    Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS +10.7%) flies higher after earnings, with the company expecting Ocwen's (OCN +2.5%) agreement to buy $78B in MSRs from OneWest Bank to boost non-GSE loans on which it earns revenue by 65% Y/Y in Q4. "We expect earnings for the 2nd half of 2013 and FY2014 to be very strong." Gross margins fell to 43% from 44% a year ago as staffing levels have been beefed up to meet the new loans about to be boarded. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • CVX

    Repsol asks a World Bank panel to block Chevron's (CVX +1%) $1.24B deal with YPF (YPF -2.7%) to...

    Repsol asks a World Bank panel to block Chevron's (CVX +1%) $1.24B deal with YPF (YPF -2.7%) to develop shale assets in Argentina's Vaca Muerta formation (now estimated to contain 1,181T cu. ft. of shale gas). Repsol's complaint comes as it disputes the seizure of its 51% stake in YPF by Argentina's government last year; YPF says the claims lack judicial merit since Repsol never owned rights over Vaca Muerta.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • TKR

    Timken (TKR -4.9%) tumbles after Q2 earnings miss estimates. A 16% Y/Y drop in revenue is...

    Timken (TKR -4.9%) tumbles after Q2 earnings miss estimates. A 16% Y/Y drop in revenue is attributed to lower demand as well as "the impact of the company's market strategy in the light-vehicle sector." CEO James Griffith says TKR did well to maintain double-digit operating margins in a weak market but notes that the "outlook for the year now reflects a more modest market recovery." Revenue growth by segment: Mobile Industries, -12%; Process Industries, -23%; Aerospace, -6%; Steel, -29%. FY13 outlook: $3.30-3.60/ share on -10% revenue growth. Consensus is $3.97/ share. On the call, management declines to discuss its ongoing evaluation of a steel business spinoff. (PR, CC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • LAZ

    Lazard (LAZ +5.6%) gets past a weak deal market, reporting a 9% increase (earnings) in its...

    Lazard (LAZ +5.6%) gets past a weak deal market, reporting a 9% increase (earnings) in its financial advisory business in Q2 thanks to getting a piece of 4 out of 10 of the largest M&A deals this year. Compensation expense rose 17%, but as a percentage of revenue fell to 60% from 62.7% a year ago. Evercore (EVR +1%) also overcame the sluggish environment (earnings), taking market share as investment banking revenues rose 18.8% Y/Y. Its compensation ratio dropped to 63.5% from 66.3% a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC +11.8%) soars following its Q2 earnings report. Revenue growth by segment:...

    GNC Holdings (GNC +11.8%) soars following its Q2 earnings report. Revenue growth by segment: Retail, +9.6%; Franchise, +6.8%; Manufacturing/Wholesale, +11.1%. Comps growth for the period at company-owned and franchise-operated stores comes in at 6.8% and 5.2% respectively. The company says its Gold Card Member Pricing program rollout is complete and the financial impact is included in guidance. Outlook: Q3 and Q4 comps growth in the high single-digits at domestic company-owned stores and FY13 EPS of $2.83-2.88. Consensus is $2.80/ share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • CX

    Mexican cement maker Cemex (CX +1.9%) moves higher despite missing Q2 forecasts, as its U.S....

    Mexican cement maker Cemex (CX +1.9%) moves higher despite missing Q2 forecasts, as its U.S. revenue surged 3.8% to $4B thanks to the housing rebound that also pushed U.S. EBITDA to $80M, almost triple a year ago. Sterne Agee thinks the results bode well for other U.S. construction materials producers with large operations in the southeast, notably Martin Marietta (NYSE:MLM) and Vulcan Materials (NYSE:VMC).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • ESI-OLD

    Shares of ITT Educational (ESI-OLD +2.3%) have been all over the board today following the...

    Shares of ITT Educational (ESI-OLD +2.3%) have been all over the board today following the company's Q2 miss. The stock initially jumped nearly 9%, perhaps on news new student enrollment increased 7.5%. Almost all other metrics fell however, including meaningful Y/Y decreases in revenue (-21.2%), operating income, operating margin, net income, EPS, continuing students (-17.7%), total student enrollment (-11.7%), persistence rate, and revenue per student. The stock sold-off sharply during the call, falling nearly 7%, before breaking higher in afternoon trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • OKE

    ONEOK (OKE +22.4%) is soaring in reaction to plans to spin off its natural gas distribution...

    ONEOK (OKE +22.4%) is soaring in reaction to plans to spin off its natural gas distribution business into a stand-alone publicly traded company. Morgan Stanley sees still more upside ahead, upgrading shares to Overweight with a $64 price target; it believes OKE will pay a materially higher dividend with growth potential of 20% through 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN +12.4%) soars double-digits following the company's Q2 report. Esbriet revenue...

    InterMune (ITMN +12.4%) soars double-digits following the company's Q2 report. Esbriet revenue rose 162% Y/Y and 37% Q/Q and management hiked the low end of its FY revenue guidance for the drug. Stifel's Stephen Wiley reiterates a Buy recommendation and raises his price target to $18 (from $17) saying Q4 "now likely represents the long-awaited inflection point investors have been waiting to materialize." Nevertheless, Wiley warns pressure could come in the form of Phase 3 data due on Boehringer Ingelheim's nintedanib.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • ANGI

    Buy Angie's List (ANGI -8.9%) on weakness, says Needham's Kerry Rice, reiterating a Buy and...

    Buy Angie's List (ANGI -8.9%) on weakness, says Needham's Kerry Rice, reiterating a Buy and hiking the PT to $30 from $25 following last night's earnings miss. "We believe management is pulling the correct levers to improve marketing yield while driving strong revenue growth." RayJay takes chips off the table, downgrading to Outperform from Strong Buy. (earnings last night)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX +5.2%) shares rise despite a surprise Q2 loss as revenue sank and fewer funds...

    Consol Energy (CNX +5.2%) shares rise despite a surprise Q2 loss as revenue sank and fewer funds are gleaned from asset sales. Still, CNX is seeing better demand this month for its U.S. thermal coal because of curtailments at some competitors as well as increased power demand. CNX says it is "evaluating our overall corporate structure to consider different alternatives to unlock additional value for shareholders."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALKS

    More on Alkermes (ALKS +5.6%) Q2: Shares rise as results comfortably beat estimates. Revenues...

    More on Alkermes (ALKS +5.6%) Q2: Shares rise as results comfortably beat estimates. Revenues from ALKS' "five key products" increase 22% Y/Y. Risperdal, Consta, Invega Sustenna/ Xeplion manufacturing and royalty revenues rise 16% Y/Y. Ampyra/ Fampyra manufacturing and royalty revenues jump 16% from Q2 2012. Vivitrol net sales are up 40%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +6.4%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with an $85 price target at Stifel...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +6.4%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with an $85 price target at Stifel Nicolaus, which notes COG's Q2 results included a higher free cash flow outlook, improved visibility surrounding the outlook, and the fact that gas has corrected from earlier this year. The additional Marcellus rig increases the firm's 2014 cash flow/share estimate to $8.56 from $8.31 vs. consensus of $7.98.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    Buy the dip in Western Digital (WDC -6.2%) says FBN's Shebly Seyrafi, calling at least some of...

    Buy the dip in Western Digital (WDC -6.2%) says FBN's Shebly Seyrafi, calling at least some of this morning's decline profit-taking, though he does worry the quarter's operating expenses came in higher than expected. Craig-Hallum's Christian Schwab downgrades to Sell, arguing there's no growth in the business. Needham's Rich Kugele reiterates his Strong Buy and $77 PT, noting outperformance on margins and earnings despite some handicaps. Seagate (STX -4.7%) slips with analysts suggesting there's been a slight share-shift to Western as Seagate avoided weak pricing in the PC market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • WTI

    W&T Offshore (WTI +3.6%) makes a subsalt discovery in a deep shelf exploratory target...

    W&TÂ Offshore (WTI +3.6%) makes a subsalt discovery in a deep shelf exploratory target beneath its Mahogany field, and is producing at an initial rate of ~3K bbl/day of oil 5.6M cu. ft./day of gas for a total of ~4K boe/day. CEO Tracy Krohn cites "a very high quality oil sand in the T-Sand reservoir with great flow characteristics."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PHM

    The Homebuilders ETFs (XHB -2.6%), (ITB -4.3%) slip after earnings from PulteGroup (PHM -9.3%)...

    The Homebuilders ETFs (XHB -2.6%), (ITB -4.3%) slip after earnings from PulteGroup (PHM -9.3%) and D.R. Horton (DHI -8.2%), with Pulte notable for reporting a big decline in orders (interest rates on the rise again aren't helping). Goldman reiterates its Sell rating on Pulte, noting the need to be selective within the sector. Others: Toll Brothers (TOL -2.4%), KB Home (KBH -5.8%), Lennar (LEN -4.8%), and also reportingÂ M/I Homes (MHO -7.3%), and Ryland (RYL -8.1%). One homebuilder/landowner caught up in the selloff is UCP, Inc. (UCP -2.4%) - a promising play that may be the victim of a poorly-timed IPO, says SA Pro's Money Investor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical (DOW +1.5%) can thank a river of floating dead pigs in China for a large chunk of...

    Dow Chemical (DOW +1.5%) can thank a river of floating dead pigs in China for a large chunk of its $1B in Q2 net earnings for its plastics business segment, a 30% Y/Y gain, as food safety concerns send Chinese shoppers to grocery stores to buy pre-packaged food. That's a boost for Dow and others using cheap U.S. natural gas to manufacture the plastic casings used to protect food in transit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • CROX

    Hedgeye isn't going easy on the sell-side of the Street this morning, noting nary an analyst had...

    Hedgeye isn't going easy on the sell-side of the Street this morning, noting nary an analyst had a Sell rating on Crocs (CROX -21.2%) in front of its Q2 earnings bomb. Goldman Sachs had the most outlandish take on the retailer, calling for a healthy beat. Sterne Agee's Sam Poser deserves a little credit though for taking Crocs execs to task during the earnings call for the firm's overly optimistic guidance. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 4 Comments
  • CRIS

    Curis (CRIS +2.2%) initiates a Phase 1 dose-escalation study of the oral, synthetic, small...

    Curis (CRIS +2.2%) initiates a Phase 1 dose-escalation study of the oral, synthetic, small molecule CUDC-427 in patients with advanced and refractory solid tumors or lymphoma. The company says the trial "builds on the single agent clinical results observed in the initial Phase 1 trial of CUDC-427, which were presented at ASCO." It's worth noting that the stock fell sharply from June 3-June 5 following the company's ASCO presentation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • QCOM

    Citing "device exhaustion," Citi's Glen Yeung removes his Buy rating on Qualcom (QCOM +2.9%) and...

    Citing "device exhaustion," Citi's Glen Yeung removes his Buy rating on Qualcom (QCOM +2.9%) and cuts the price target $11 to $70. Demand for high-end smartphones is decelerating as markets near saturation, with lack of hardware innovation also likely to weigh. "QCOM is relegated to a trading stock." Also cut are Avago Technologies (AVGO -0.8%) and MagnaChip (MX -7.2%). Nomura's Romit Shah hikes his QCOM PT $3 to $78, noting the earnings call (transcript) strongly suggested new product launches should drive big growth in the December quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 9 Comments
  • TEVA

    Teva (TEVA -0.6%) and Lonza (OTCPK:LZAGY -5.8%) mutually agree to terminate their biosimilars collaboration following a strategic review.
